comment: A set ` A ` is an element of ` setrecs ( F ) ` iff ` A ` is generated by some subset of ` setrecs ( F ) ` . The proof requires both ~ setrec1 and ~ setrec2 , but this theorem is not strong enough to uniquely determine ` setrecs ( F ) ` . If ` F ` respects the subset relation, the theorem still holds if both occurrences of ` e. ` are replaced by ` C_ ` for a stronger version of the theorem. (Contributed by Emmett Weisz, 12-Jul-2021.)
